text: Petrine Olgeirdottir (born 13 April 1994) is a Norwegian deaf snowboarder.https://www.deaflympics.com/athletes/petrine-olgeirsdottir She competed at the 2015 Winter Deaflympics and bagged a silver medal in the women's slopestyle event. She was just one of three participants to have represented Norway during the 2015 Winter Deaflympics and was the only medalist for Norway.https://www.deaflympics.com/games/2015-w/NOR Petrine also became the first Norwegian to win a medal in Winter Deaflympics since Norway's return to Winter Games since 2003. Prior to her achievement, retired veteran cross country skier Tone Tangen Myrvoll was the last Norwegian to claim a Winter Deaflympic medal. == References == Category:1994 births Category:Living people Category:Norwegian female snowboarders Category:Deaf sportspeople Category:Deaf people from Norway Category:Medalists at the 2015 Winter Deaflympics Category:Deaflympic silver medalists for Norway
title: Petrine Olgeirsdottir
